title.narrative: Togo COVID-19 Emergency Response and Systems Preparedness Strengthening Project

description.narrative: To prevent, detect and respond to the threat posed by COVID-19 and strengthen national systems for public health preparedness in Togo.

condition.narrative: As agree in ESCP: The implementation of the detailed training plan shall be started no later than ninety (90) days after theEffective Date, and throughout the implementation of the Project.
As agreed in ESCP: A detailed training plan shall be developed not later than sixty (60) days after the Effective date.
As agreed in ESCP: The LMP shall be updated and disclosed within 30 days of the Effective Date.

As agreed in ESCP: The SEA/SH Prevention and Response Action Plan shall be prepared, disclosed, and consulted upon and adopted notlater than three (3) months after the Effective Date and implemented throughout the life of the project.
Per ESCP a detailed training plan shall be developed not later than sixty (60) days after the effective date.
Per ESCP the implementation of the detailed training plan shall be started no later than ninety (90) days after the effective date,and throughout the implementation of the project.

Project Paper. Citizen Engagement and Outreach. A communication specialist shall be recruited within the PCU no later than one (1)month after the project effectiveness of the project to carry out the communication strategy related to COVID-19 immunization.

Project Paper: Financial Management. Main Mitigation Measures include: (i) migrating the existing accounting software's parametersto fit the needs of the AF by no later than three (3) months after the effective date;
Project Paper: Financial Management. Main Mitigation Measures include: (ii) finalizing the recruitment of an accountant by no laterthan three (3) months after the effective date.

Schedule 2 Section I.A.2. The Recipient shall ensure that the PCU has recruited, by no later than January 31, 2022, anenvironmental specialist with terms of reference, qualifications, and experience satisfactory to the Association.

Schedule 2 Section I.A.2. The Recipient shall ensure that the PCU recruits (i) no later than one (1) month after the EffectiveDate, an accountant with terms of reference, qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association;

Schedule 2 Section I.A.2. The Recipient shall ensure that the PCU recruits (ii) no later than four (4) months after the EffectiveDate an environmental specialist, with terms of reference, qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association;
Schedule 2 Section I.A.2.(iii) updates the accounting software no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, or such laterdate as agreed by the Association.

Schedule 2 Section I.B.2.(a) by no later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, prepare a draft work plan and budget forProject implementation, setting forth, inter alia: (i) a detailed description of the planned activities, including any proposedconferences and Training, under the Project for the period covered by the plan; (ii) the sources and proposed use of fundstherefor; (iii) procurement and environmental and social safeguards arrangements therefor, as applicable and; (iv) responsibilityfor the execution of said Project activities, budgets, start and completion dates, outputs and monitoring indicators to trackprogress of each activity.

Schedule 2, Section I.B. 2.(a) by no later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, prepare a draft work plan and budget forProject implementation, setting forth, inter alia: (i) a detailed description of the planned activities, including any proposedconferences and Training, under the Project for the period covered by the plan; (ii) the sources and proposed use of fundstherefor; (iii) procurement and environmental and social safeguards arrangements therefor, as applicable; and (iv) responsibilityfor the execution of said Project activities, budgets, start and completion dates, outputs and monitoring indicators to trackprogress of each activity

Schedule 2. Section I. B.1. (a)The Recipient shall by no later than one (1) month, after the Effective Date, prepare and adopt aProject implementation manual (“Project Implementation Manual”) containing detailed guidelines and procedures for theimplementation of the Project, including with respect to: administration and coordination, monitoring and evaluation, financialmanagement, procurement and accounting procedures, environmental and social safeguards, corruption and fraud mitigation measures, agrievance redress mechanism, personal data collection and processing in accordance with the applicable WHO and national guidelines,roles and responsibilities for Project implementation, and such other arrangements and procedures as shall be required for theeffective implementation of the Project, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association.

Schedule 2. Section I. B.2.(a) by no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, prepare a draft work plan and budget forProject implementation, setting forth, inter alia: (i) a detailed description of the planned activities, including any proposedconferences and Training, under the Project for the period covered by the plan; (ii) the sources and proposed use of fundstherefor; (iii) procurement and environmental and social safeguards arrangements therefor, as applicable and; (iv) responsibilityfor the execution of said Project activities, budgets, start and completion dates, outputs and monitoring indicators to trackprogress of each activity.
Schedule 2.Section I. A.2. The Recipient shall ensure that the PCU (i) recruits an accountant and (ii) updates the accountingsoftware no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date.

Schedule 2.Section I.B.1.(a) The Recipient shall by no later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, update the Projectimplementation manual for the Original Project (as so updated, “Project Implementation Manual”) containing detailed guidelines andprocedures for the implementation of the Project, including with respect to: administration and coordination, monitoring andevaluation, financial management, procurement and accounting procedures, environmental and social safeguards, corruption and fraudmitigation measures, a grievance redress mechanism, eligibility criteria, personal data collection and processing in accordancewith the applicable WHO and national guidelines, roles and responsibilities for Project implementation, and such other arrangementsand procedures as shall be required for the effective implementation of the Project, in form and substance satisfactory to theAssociation.
